item.title: Report X-2025020558
item.description:
Report X-2025020558

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained a single plastic bottle that was packaged in a paper envelope with bubble wrap for dunnage. The cap on the plastic bottle was loose causing a release of the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025020118
item.description:
Report E-2025020118

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0359 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NKX. It was reported that approximately 10-gallons of Earthguard 4000 released from a metal drum due to dunnage. The release impacted inside of trailer #311-5401. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO will use a 65-gallon metal drum for waste. ERTS generated alert ID 224463-1. ERTS notified Chemtrec, Esther provided report #2025011000018.

item.title: Report E-2025020094
item.description:
Report E-2025020094

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Skyline Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 08, 2025, Titan Transfer Inc. notified Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a cargo release in Cleveland, TN. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Sodium Hydroxide solution released from a plastic tote due to improper handling. The release impacted a trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Hepaco was dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up. Upon arrival Hepaco reported the team found the cause of the spill. It was a bung cap that fell out of the tote. Any product that leaked had already dried. The team replaced and secured the tote. All onsite was complete with no waste generated. The team departed the site.

Inside of the box was four bottles of perfume packaged with fiberboard dividers and packing paper for dunnage. One of the bottles broke spilling the contents in the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025020108
item.description:
Report X-2025020108

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-27
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EXPORT DOCUMENTS FOR ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM TN, USA TO US VIRGIN ISLANDS WAS INSPECTED. THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBES CONTENTS AS AGM BATTERY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE D5100R NON-SPILLABLE LEAD ACID BATTERY INSIDE THE PACKAGE. INVOICE AND PACKING SLIP INDICATE A BATTERY IS BEING SHIPPED. THE BOX HAS TWO PACKING LIST ENCLOSED POUCHES APPLIED WITH THE LETTERS "AGM NON-" VISIBLE NEXT TO ONE OF THE POUCHES. THERE ARE NO VISIBLE DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING NON-SPILLABLE BATTERY. THE INNER BOX HOLDING THE BATTERY DOES INDICATE CONTENTS AS D5100R 12V AGM POWERCELL SEALED NON-SPILLABLE LEAD ACID BATTERY. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:
Report E-2025020035

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0413 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo incident at terminal BNA. It was reported approximately 0.25-teaspoon of Gardofloc Q 8528 released from a paper bag due to a packaging defect. The was contained to the bag. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contract for clean up since the product is Haz class 8; XPO declined and felt comfortable cleaning up the spill. A 65-gallon poly drum will be used for waste.

item.title: Report I-2025010018
item.description:
Report I-2025010018

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: DANDRIDGE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Medical Delivery Services
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 11 :00 am ET on December 11, PETNET Knoxville-UT was notified that an MDS courier transporting three PETNET cases containing live patient doses had been involved in a single-vehicle rollover accident on eastbound Interstate 40 near mile marker 424. The bills of lading for those packages are in Attachment 1. The cases contained a total of five patient doses with a combined activity of approximately 210 mCi of Flourine-18 at the time of the accident, and were being delivered to Haywood Regional Medical Center in Clyde, NC. Although the delivery vehicle appeared to have rolled over several times, no cases were ejected. However, a hazmat team responded to the scene and closed the eastbound lanes of the interstate for several hours. Corporate Health Physicist Chris Walters made phone contact with Chief Lee Turner, who was on the scene of the accident, at approximately 11 :40 am to assess the situation. As a result of that conversation, he requested an on-site visit from the corporate Radiation Protection team. Chief Turner relayed that he had also alerted the TN Division of Radiological Health. At approximately 1:00 PM, Corporate Radiation Safety Officer Elizabeth Gillenwalters and Health Physicist Chris Hile arrived at the scene of the accident. Using a Ludlum 44-9 pancake probe with a Model 3 Meter and a Ludlum 26-1 Integrated Frisker, very careful surveys of the vehicle, one officer's clothing that had been reported as possibly contaminated, and the surrounding area were performed. No results greater than background were identified in any areas or materials surveyed. The officer's clothing items were left at the scene. All three delivery cases were still intact with the security zip tie still in place. Each case was thoroughly wiped on the outside, and the wipes surveyed with the Ludlum 26-1 Integrated Frisker. No results greater than background were identified, verifying no material had left containment. The cases were loaded into our vehicle and returned them to the PETNET UT Knoxville facility, located within the UT Medical Center. Additional photos of the packages and the scene are included in Attachments 2 and 3, respectively.
